snippet: On the day of Andrew Cuomo’s inauguration for his second term as governor of New York, his father, Mario Cuomo, died, commanding the state’s attention.
abstract: Andrew M Cuomo is sworn in for his second term as governor of New York on same day his father Mario Cuomo, three-term governor of New York, dies; Andrew Cuomo reflects on his father’s legacy during his inaugural address, and notes he read his father a draft of his speech at his bedside.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and SUSANNE CRAIG
byline.contributor: Thomas Kaplan and Michael Barbaro contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: On the day of Andrew Cuomo’s inauguration for his second term as governor of New York, his father, Mario Cuomo, died, commanding the state’s attention.

headline.main: One Last Confluence for Mario and Andrew Cuomo, Proud Rivals
headline.print_headline: One Last Confluence for Cuomos, Proud Rivals
